attributes.action: Hold a 2nd referendum on Brexit when the terms of exit have been negotiated
attributes.additional_details: "Article 50 has a timebomb provision that gives negotiators two years from the date of article 50 notification to conclude new arrangements. Failure to do so results in the exiting state falling out of the EU with no new provisions in place, unless every one of the remaining EU states agrees to extend the negotiations"
attributes.background: Regardless of how we voted on June 23rd our political class have never told us of the time-bomb nature of Article 50. After worrying about Brexit I investigated (see below). I believe that no-one who loves the UK wants Article 50 to be notified prior to the public agreeing terms of an exit
